snippet: After crusading judges in Spain ordered international warrants for a former premier and an ex-president from China, a trade partner, the Spanish Parliament will debate limiting the practice.
abstract: Spanish Parliament is expected to debate and eventually approve a bill that will force the dismissal of case against former Chinese Pres Jiang Zemin and Prime Min Li Peng for alleged human rights abuses in Tibet; bill will also sharply reduce the scope of the national law that has allowed Spanish judges to pursue human rights cases around the world.
lead_paragraph: After crusading judges in Spain ordered international warrants for a former premier and an ex-president from China, a trade partner, the Spanish Parliament will debate limiting the practice.

headline.main: Spain Seeks to Curb Law Allowing Judges to Pursue Cases Globally
headline.print_headline: Spain Seeks to Place Curbs on Law Allowing Judges to Pursue Cases Globally

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
